drug.name: Besifloxacin
drug.description: Besifloxacin is a fourth generation fluoroquinolone-type opthalmic antibiotic for the treatment of bacterial conjunctivitis. FDA approved on May 28, 2009.

article.citation: O'Brien TP: Besifloxacin ophthalmic suspension, 0.6%: a novel topical fluoroquinolone for bacterial conjunctivitis. Adv Ther. 2012 Jun;29(6):473-90. doi: 10.1007/s12325-012-0027-7. Epub 2012 Jun 20.

Proksch JW, Granvil CP, Siou-Mermet R, Comstock TL, Paterno MR, Ward KW: Ocular pharmacokinetics of besifloxacin following topical administration to rabbits, monkeys, and humans. J Ocul Pharmacol Ther. 2009 Aug;25(4):335-44. doi: 10.1089/jop.2008.0116.

drug.indication: Treatment of bacterial conjunctivitis. Bacterial isolates that are susceptible to besifloxacin include: CDC coryneform group G; Corynebacterium pseudodiphtheriticum; Corynebacterium striatum; Haemophilus influenzae; Moraxella lacunata; Staphylococcus aureus; Staphylococcus epidermidis; Staphylococcus hominis; Staphylococcus lugdunensis; Streptococcus mitis group; Streptococcus oralis; Streptococcus pneumoniae; Streptococcus salivarius*
drug.pharmacodynamics: Besifloxacin tear concentrations were higher than MIC90 (minimum inhibitory concentration) values for common bacterial pathogens and sustained for 24 hours or longer. Mean residence time in the conjunctiva was 4.7 hours.
drug.mechanism-of-action: Besifloxacin is a bactericidal fluroquinolone-type antibiotic that inhibits bacterial enzymes, DNA gyrase and topoisomerase IV. By inhibiting DNA gyrase, DNA replication, transcription, and repair is impaired. By inhibiting topoisomerase IV, decatenation during cell devision is impaired. Inhibiting these two targets also slows down development of resistance.
drug.toxicity: LD50, rat: >2000 mg/kg. The most common adverse reaction reported in 2% of patients treated with besifloxacin was conjunctival redness.
drug.absorption: Although ocular surface concentrations are high, average systemic concentrtions after three-times daily dosing was less than 0.5 ng/mL. This indicates that besifloxacin is not appreciably absorbed into the systemic and has a very low risk of systemic side effects.
drug.half-life: The average elimination half-life of besifloxacin in plasma following multiple dosing was estimated to be 7 hours.

classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as quinoline carboxylic acids. These are quinolines in which the quinoline ring system is substituted by a carboxyl group at one or more positions.

affected-organisms.affected-organism: Gram negative and gram positive bacteria

drug-interaction.name: Trazodone
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of QTc prolongation can be increased when Trazodone is combined with Besifloxacin.

drug-interaction.name: Pitolisant
drug-interaction.description: Besifloxacin may increase the QTc-prolonging activities of Pitolisant.

drug-interaction.name: Lefamulin
drug-interaction.description: Lefamulin may increase the QTc-prolonging activities of Besifloxacin.

target.name: DNA topoisomerase 4 subunit A
target.organism: Haemophilus influenzae (strain ATCC 51907 / DSM 11121 / KW20 / Rd)

article.citation: Carter NJ, Scott LJ: Besifloxacin ophthalmic suspension 0.6%. Drugs. 2010;70(1):83-97. doi: 10.2165/11203820-000000000-00000.

polypeptide.name: DNA topoisomerase 4 subunit A
polypeptide.specific-function: Topoisomerase IV is essential for chromosome segregation. It relaxes supercoiled DNA. Performs the decatenation events required during the replication of a circular DNA molecule.
polypeptide.organism: Haemophilus influenzae (strain ATCC 51907 / DSM 11121 / KW20 / Rd)

target.name: DNA topoisomerase 4 subunit A
target.organism: Streptococcus pneumoniae serotype 4 (strain ATCC BAA-334 / TIGR4)

article.citation: Carter NJ, Scott LJ: Besifloxacin ophthalmic suspension 0.6%. Drugs. 2010;70(1):83-97. doi: 10.2165/11203820-000000000-00000.

polypeptide.name: DNA topoisomerase 4 subunit A
polypeptide.specific-function: Topoisomerase IV is essential for chromosome segregation. It relaxes supercoiled DNA. Performs the decatenation events required during the replication of a circular DNA molecule.
polypeptide.organism: Streptococcus pneumoniae serotype 4 (strain ATCC BAA-334 / TIGR4)

target.name: DNA gyrase subunit A
target.organism: Haemophilus influenzae (strain ATCC 51907 / DSM 11121 / KW20 / Rd)

article.citation: Carter NJ, Scott LJ: Besifloxacin ophthalmic suspension 0.6%. Drugs. 2010;70(1):83-97. doi: 10.2165/11203820-000000000-00000.

polypeptide.name: DNA gyrase subunit A
polypeptide.specific-function: DNA gyrase negatively supercoils closed circular double-stranded DNA in an ATP-dependent manner and also catalyzes the interconversion of other topological isomers of double-stranded DNA rings, including catenanes and knotted rings.
polypeptide.organism: Haemophilus influenzae (strain ATCC 51907 / DSM 11121 / KW20 / Rd)

target.name: DNA gyrase subunit A
target.organism: Streptococcus pneumoniae serotype 4 (strain ATCC BAA-334 / TIGR4)

article.citation: Carter NJ, Scott LJ: Besifloxacin ophthalmic suspension 0.6%. Drugs. 2010;70(1):83-97. doi: 10.2165/11203820-000000000-00000.

polypeptide.name: DNA gyrase subunit A
polypeptide.specific-function: DNA gyrase negatively supercoils closed circular double-stranded DNA in an ATP-dependent manner and also catalyzes the interconversion of other topological isomers of double-stranded DNA rings, including catenanes and knotted rings.
polypeptide.organism: Streptococcus pneumoniae serotype 4 (strain ATCC BAA-334 / TIGR4)

article.citation: Zhang L, Wei MJ, Zhao CY, Qi HM: Determination of the inhibitory potential of 6 fluoroquinolones on CYP1A2 and CYP2C9 in human liver microsomes. Acta Pharmacol Sin. 2008 Dec;29(12):1507-14. doi: 10.1111/j.1745-7254.2008.00908.x.

Shahzadi A, Javed I, Aslam B, Muhammad F, Asi MR, Ashraf MY, Zia-ur-Rahman: Therapeutic effects of ciprofloxacin on the pharmacokinetics of carbamazepine in healthy adult male volunteers. Pak J Pharm Sci. 2011 Jan;24(1):63-8.

polypeptide.name: Cytochrome P450 1A2
polypeptide.general-function: Oxidoreductase activity, acting on paired donors, with incorporation or reduction of molecular oxygen, reduced flavin or flavoprotein as one donor, and incorporation of one atom of oxygen
polypeptide.specific-function: Cytochromes P450 are a group of heme-thiolate monooxygenases. In liver microsomes, this enzyme is involved in an NADPH-dependent electron transport pathway. It oxidizes a variety of structurally unrelated compounds, including steroids, fatty acids, and xenobiotics. Most active in catalyzing 2-hydroxylation. Caffeine is metabolized primarily by cytochrome CYP1A2 in the liver through an initial N3-demethylation. Also acts in the metabolism of aflatoxin B1 and acetaminophen. Participates in the bioactivation of carcinogenic aromatic and heterocyclic amines. Catalizes the N-hydroxylation of heterocyclic amines and the O-deethylation of phenacetin.

go-classifier.description: oxidoreductase activity, acting on paired donors, with incorporation or reduction of molecular oxygen, reduced flavin or flavoprotein as one donor, and incorporation of one atom of oxygen
